div.head: 475 A powder for the green Sicknessickness
div.p:
Take annaseeds aniseeds
nutmugs nutmegs
alicampaineelecampane roots beat them to powder of each a like
quantity quantity
sears the powders take as much more of the quantity of Sugarsugar as
of the powders

div.head: The decoktion and opening for the Same
div.p: Take peniriall unset Isop mother of time fethertule mugwort mader marygoold flowers leaues Iarmander bitany bugals mallows uiolet leaues fenill percily root with 4 or 5 blades of Safron boyl all these in a good quantity of ayle drink a good draught of it morning and euening

div.head: A drink for the green Sickness
div.p: Egremony one hadfull wormwood and sentry of each halph a ha^n^dfull boyl it in 3 pints of water 1 pint of white wine boyl it halph an owr then drink euery mor^i^ng halph a pynt of it in the after noon as much its best to be taken in the spring

div.head: to bring down them
div.p: Sentry boyld in posit drink with currans is good or Sauin So boyld and drund leaues of Smallage worn in the shows is good

div.head: For green Sicknes or dropsy
div.p: Take yallow sentry three drams giuen in a dram of annaseeds caraway seeds in wine or any other liqur is good

div.head: For the whits
div.p: Take parsnips dry then beat them to powder then boyl that powder in milk drink it warm it helps

div.head: For the green Sicknes
div.p: Take Magistry of pearll powder of stell powder of amber powder of currell powder of allicompaine of each a quarter of an ounce mase cloues nutmugs of all a quarte of an ounce as much dubell refined sugar of all these take as much as will ly on Sixpenc in the morning at 6 a clok at four in after noone waiking after it
